concept.title: Quick Start Step 3:
concept.shortdesc: During this step you will log into and use the web console to create a sandbox environment.

ol.li: Log into the Horizon console using the username and password that you created during registration.

Create a public-facing network.
Click Project Network Routers + Create Router .
Enter a router name tand click Create Router.
To connect your router to the external network (Ext-Net), click Set Gateway in your router's row.
Select Ext-Net as the External Network and click Set Gateway.
To confirm that your router is configured correctly, click Project Network Topology and ensure that your router is connected to the Ext-Net network. For detailed configuration instructions, see this page.

To activate the Compute service required for creating VM instances, click Activate in the Computer row of the US West section. Due to load balancing, your account may be provisioned to use US East instead of US West. If Launch Instance is disabled in the Instances pane, try the other region.

To download the configuration file, click Project Compute Access and Security API Access Download OpenStack RC File .A configuration .rc file contains information about a hosted service, including region, tenant, and other information required to create a cluster. This file is pre-configured for your sandbox environment.

Create a key pair.
Click Project Compute Access & Security Key Pairs + Create Key Pair
Enter a key pair name and click Create Key Pair
If the key pair does not download automatically, click the link and save the <filename>.pem file in a convenient location. The .pem file contains the RSA private key that you will need to SSH into your VM instance.
